text:
Hi Guys, I have two questions
1. This is question about Email Template.
       In RICH Text Editor -> Tool bar --> More --> Font
       I need to add custom font here, please help me add in templates
 2.  Next the question is about
       in the Marketing->Files & Templates->Design Tools
       I tried to add custom font css code all pages of email templates, and how to apply inline font to body content of p, div, CTA and forms
Please help me to get solution.
Thanks
Does the new `hiddenModules` and `hiddenSections` in the template annotations not work on child theme templates?
:exclamation: This is a timeline emergency for me. Can anyone replicate this :point_up_2::skin-tone-2:? :pray::skin-tone-2:
I wish I could be more helpful but honestly I really don't know. Let's see if any of these smart people know: <@UBT0AHWLD>, <@U2LEJ045D>, <@U25PYL3Q8>
CC <@U04AQA0QM8E> maybe you know what's going on?

Oh, this is an interesting one. I haven’t used this in conjunction with child themes yet, so I don’t know off the top of my head.

<@U03CGBABA8M> Have you run into this issue?
<@U3T21PDBK> do you have it in the JSON and the html?

```<!--
  templateType: page
  isAvailableForNewContent: true
  label: Phase 1 – LP Drag and Drop
  hiddenModules:
  - '@HubSpot/follow_me'
  - ../../modules/accordion
  - ../../modules/cards
-->```
on the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/themes/hide-modules-and-sections#hide-modules-and-sections-in-a-template|template level>
Hmm, have you tried referencing the theme folder directly instead of using relative paths? I’ve had some real hit-or-miss luck with relative paths in the last month.

from hs docs on the link above :point_up_2::skin-tone-2:
> When hiding modules and sections, keep the following in mind:
> …
> You must use the relative path when specifying a hidden module. Using an absolute path will result in the module not being hidden.
Whoops, my mistake. Multitasking. :sweat_smile:
But heck I’ll still try lol
maybe hiding on a template level does not work for child themes somehow, have you tried hiding on a theme level?
i know the difference and why you are doing it like that
theme level works for hiding hs modules successfully in this child theme
My other thought, your relative path backs out by two levels instead of one — are you using a nonstandard file structure for your templates?
dnd-phase-1.html is the template… I should be all set on the paths. But i’ve tried every combo of paths just incase :rolling_on_the_floor_laughing:
Roger that. I hope that doesn’t come across as condescending, just trying to rule out all of the “oh my god I overlooked a typo” possibilities.
I never am offended by a “have you checked your pockets?” question
have you tried this with hidden sections?
can you hide a @HubSpot default module?
The hidden sections don’t work either. I even tried changing `hiddenModules` to `hidden_modules` and same with sections and still didn’t work
Yeah, you can hide the default modules.

Hiding hs modules works at the theme.json.
But I tried just hiding a HubSpot module on a template level with no luck in child theme
```<!--
  templateType: page
  isAvailableForNewContent: true
  label: Phase 1 – LP Drag and Drop
  hiddenModules:
  - '@HubSpot/follow_me'
-->```
i know, just wanted to know if it works :slightly_smiling_face:
can you maybe try to create a new page to see if that changes anything?
Just tested it — can confirm that I can hide child theme modules and HubSpot default modules on a template level, in a child theme.
I don’t know if I’m happy about this or sad :rolling_on_the_floor_laughing:
is this a subscription issue?
THIS IS A STARTER PORTAL

```<!--
  templateType: page
  isAvailableForNewContent: true
  label: Simple Page
  screenshotPath: ../images/template-previews/simple.png
  hiddenModules:
  - '@HubSpot/header'
  - ../modules/events-listing
-->```
Both of these worked as expected. Are you hiding inherited modules, or child theme-specific modules?
why All Caps?
why title caps?
sorry I have nothing to contribute here — but i’m following along
The test I did was in a standard developer portal.
wasn’t directed at a person <@U25PYL3Q8> but I am going to bang my head against the desk if it is permission related :rolling_on_the_floor_laughing: cc <@UBT0AHWLD>
i mean, we have ruled out a ton of stuff already
i am just trying to come up with stuff that might help to solve the puzzle even if its a little far fetched
thank you <@UBT0AHWLD> <@U04AQA0QM8E> <@U01QVR44MEY> – especially Andreas for asking the magic subscription issue question. I think that is it… gonna test and confirm in other portals
I'm not doing anything
Just freaking love watching a couple of super smart people help someone
Greatest community ever
oh wow now i have to repeat what <@U3T21PDBK> just said “I don’t know if I’m happy about this or sad :rolling_on_the_floor_laughing:”
but if its indeed that, that would not be good, right?

Some other things to look at, based on the differences between my working sample and your non-working sample:
• Template file structure
• Defining a screenshot path?
• The en/em dash in the template label?
i mean, i understand that there is a need for “upgrade reasons” but hiding a module??
i have thought about this screenshot path as well, though i have had templates without it, that also worked..
Particularly, I’m wondering if the `hiddenModule` property is even getting read. Or if there’s something that’s causing the front matter template data to stop parsing after the template label.
so a dash could throw this of?
never thought about that, very interesting <@U04AQA0QM8E>

YAML tends to be pretty fragile — including a non-ASCII character in something that hasn’t been quoted as a string *could* cause issues. Especially with how important dashes and whitespace are to its syntax.
ahh, yeah that makes sense
has anyone else have experience with dashes in the template label <@U25PYL3Q8>, <@U01QVR44MEY>?
though <@U3T21PDBK> would have probably not used it if it would cause issues, right?
I haven't but I mostly use camelCase
me too!
or if i do, i use dashes without spacing
that very well could be an issue
